triples.name: Reachability analysis
triples.relevance: The primary problem and main focus of the paper, involving computing sets of reachable states in dynamical systems.

triples.name: Dynamical system
triples.relevance: The fundamental mathematical framework for modeling systems whose state evolves over time according to specific rules.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: A key application domain for reachability analysis methods, used to prove properties of system models.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: The theoretical foundation for controller synthesis, one of the main application areas mentioned for reachability analysis.

triples.name: State observer
triples.relevance: Related to estimation and state inference, which is listed as an application of reachability analysis techniques.

triples.name: Hybrid system
triples.relevance: A specific class of dynamical system combining continuous and discrete behavior that is explicitly covered in the paper.

triples.name: Linear system
triples.relevance: A fundamental class of systems for which set propagation reachability techniques are applied and discussed.

triples.name: Nonlinear system
triples.relevance: A more complex class of systems that the paper addresses with set propagation methods for reachability analysis.
